docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 8 -- The deadlock between Yugoslavia and the Philippines for a seat on the Security Council reached record proportions today.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 8 -- The deadlock between Yugoslavia and the Philippines for a seat on the Security Council reached record proportions today.
docs.abstract: Assembly, after 21st ballot, fails to break Yugoslav-Philippine deadlock; ballot record set; debate deferred 2 wks; Lodge says 'new Idea' may break deadlock; reptdly refers to rotation plan

headline.main: U. N. COUNCIL SEAT REMAINS UNFILLED AFTER 21 BALLOTS; Philippine-Yugoslav Contest Sets a Deadlock Record -Voting Put Off 2 Weeks U. N. SEAT VACANT AFTER 21 BALLOTS

byline.original: By LINDESAY PARROTTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 9 -- South Africa today quit the General Assembly's tenth session. The walkout came in protest against continued United Nations inquiries into the South African Government's race segregation policies.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 9 -- South Africa today quit the General Assembly's tenth session. The walkout came in protest against continued United Nations inquiries into the South African Government's race segregation policies.
docs.abstract: U of S Afr delegation walks out of UN Assembly to protest Special Pol Com decision to continue 3-man comm probe of racial policies; com vote is 37-7 with 13 abstentions; tabulation; delegation leader du Plessis attacks inquiry as 'illegal' interference with state's internal affairs; complains move was instigated by Asian-African bloc, joined by some Latin Amers; sees threat to UN; scores role of India and Pakistan; recalls late Premier Smuts '46 stand against UN intervention

headline.main: SOUTH AFRICANS LEAVE ASSEMBLY; PROTEST U. N. ACTS; Walkout Follows Committee Vote of 37-7 to Continue Race Law Inquiries South Africa Quits Assembly In Protest on Racial Inquiries

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: There have been revelations since the ousting of Argentina's President Juan D. Peron in September and the devaluation of the Argentine peso. Economic conditions in Argentina appear to have been far different from what the world had been led to...
docs.lead_paragraph: There have been revelations since the ousting of Argentina's President Juan D. Peron in September and the devaluation of the Argentine peso. Economic conditions in Argentina appear to have been far different from what the world had been led to understand.
docs.abstract: repts Peron's foreign holdings at under $5 million

headline.main: New Regime Confronts Great Needs With a Shrunken Reserve, Falling Peso; ARGENTINA TAKES GLUM INVENTORY

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 11 -- The General Assembly's Political and Security Committee declined today to invite Communist North Korea to participate in debate on the Korean question. This reaffirmed the stand of previous years.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 11 -- The General Assembly's Political and Security Committee declined today to invite Communist North Korea to participate in debate on the Korean question. This reaffirmed the stand of previous years.
docs.abstract: J Blaustein (US) tells UN Pol Com that 400-500 craft including 300 new jets are now based in NK

headline.main: North Korea Barred Again in U.N. Debate; NORTH KOREA BAN AFFIRMED IN U. N.

byline.original: By LINDESAY PARROTTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market was quiet and fairly steady during the past week. This was due in part to the abbreviated number of trading sessions when the banks were closed on Tuesday for Election Day Holiday and on Friday for Veterans Day Holiday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchange market was quiet and fairly steady during the past week. This was due in part to the abbreviated number of trading sessions when the banks were closed on Tuesday for Election Day Holiday and on Friday for Veterans Day Holiday. British pound sterling and Canadian dollar moved narrowly on moderate turnover of business.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates Week Ended Nov. 10, 1955

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14--A move was developing here today to rescue the human rights covenants from the political limbo to which they have been relegated.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14--A move was developing here today to rescue the human rights covenants from the political limbo to which they have been relegated.
docs.abstract: UN Assembly com studies US proposal to have UN make available to nations advisory services in rights field

headline.main: U. N. MOVE SOUGHT ON HUMAN RIGHTS

docs.snippet: LONDON, Nov. 14--The advance party of the Commonwealth Antarctica Expedition sailed on the afternoon tide today, but only barely.

docs.abstract: Theron sails from London; almost misses tide; NY Times gets exclusive US rights to repts by Fuchs, Hillary and other

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 15 -- The backbone of the once-powerful Peronist General Confederation of Labor was broken today.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 15 -- The backbone of the once-powerful Peronist General Confederation of Labor was broken today.
docs.abstract: Peronist hold on Confed broken; insurgent leaders help Govt frustrate gen strike; thousands still on strike; over 100 leaders held; prison terms threatened; sabotage by Peronists feared; Govt pledges aid to dem trade unionism; Min Migone to act against 'bad elements' in Confed; Govt urges press rept strike truthfully

headline.main: Peronist Hold on Unions Broken; General Strike Lags in Argentina; PERONISTS' HOLD ON UNIONS BROKEN
